text: The barrier effect is the phenomenon by which roads, highways, or railways impede the natural movement of animals. Barrier effect may also refer to: * Barrier effect (climatology), the process by which mountains block the passage of rain-producing weather systems. * Barrier effect (microbiology), the effect probiotic bacteria have to reduce the binding space for pathogens. * Barrier effect (food technology), the objective of using coatings to prevent water migration between food layers. ==See also== *
title: Barrier effect (disambiguation)
